answers.author: Stan Farmer
answers.text:
Jenny, we contract with some POAs outside the city limits for fire service.  Our rate structure is based on property valuation of all entities including City's in relation to annual budget to include capital. Comes out to about $.09 per 100 valuation for each POA.

Hello:
Here are some resources that I found on the knowledge Network that I think might be helpful to you while you do your search:
This document describes a free resource available to help volunteer and combination fire departments show the value of their services to the community:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4614/Helping_Fire_Departments_Make_the_Case_for_Community_Funding
This document highlights how  the township of Antis, Pennsylvania, and local volunteer fire companies collect payment as reimbursement for related costs from those who use fire and rescue services. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3534/Fire_Department_Billing_Ordinance
Each of these documents can give you some more information as well as poentntial contacts to answer your question in more detail.
In addition here are two cases of local governments that I found in the news that might help give you addiational information and contacts:
http://www.estesparknews.com/?p=1725
http://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/12/nyregion/12fire.html
Peggy Chasler
Knowledge Network Intern
pchasler@icma.org

author: Jenny Hesseltine
text:
Does your local government charge for services provided by the Fire Department? If so, would you mind sharing your rate structure and, in general terms, how well this works in your community?
Thanks very much!
Jenny
title: Charging for fire services
